semantic_identifier: 154: feat: Add provenance metadata to Positioning Recommendations API responses

sections.text:
## Description

This PR adds lightweight evidence/provenance metadata to each Positioning Recommendation returned by the backend, improving trust/interpretability without changing any recommendation scoring or ranking logic.

Implementation highlights:
- Introduces a new optional `provenance` object on each recommendation in the recommendations response payload.
- Populates `provenance` from the same inputs already used to generate recommendations, capturing:
  - `topSignals`: top contributing signal/source identifiers (e.g., CRM fields, interview notes, support tickets) with per-signal weights/scores where available.
  - `counts`: aggregate counts of referenced items per source type (e.g., `{ crmFieldsUsed: n, interviewsReferenced: n, ticketsReferenced: n }`).
  - `recency`: latest observed event timestamp across referenced inputs (e.g., `latestEventAt`).
- Adds backend DTO/schema updates and serialization so the new fields are included in the API response; existing clients remain compatible because the field is additive and optional.
- Adds unit/integration coverage for response shape and basic provenance computation.

Notes for consumers:
- No changes to recommendation generation logic or ordering.
- UI can optionally display the new `provenance` fields as “why we think this” context; safe to ignore if not needed.

## How Has This Been Tested?
